intro: Tachigali ptychophysca, commonly known as the red-stemmed tachigali, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant is known for its distinctive red-brown stems and its ability to thrive in humid, tropical climates. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
